October 29

Flight Number Route

5J 647/648 Manila – Puerto Princesa – Manila
5J 2503/2504 Manila – Cebu – Manila
5J 409/410 Manila – Brunei – Manila
Given the inclement weather and NAIA runways closure, Cebu Pacific (CEB) cancelled additional flights from October 29-30, 2022:
We strongly advise passengers to self-manage their options online. These options will be made available as we manage the total volume of disruptions.
The Ninoy Aquino International Airport (NAIA) runways are closed to flight operations from 4:00pm-10:00pm on October 29 due to Tropical Storm Paeng, or until the prevailing conditions improve.

Cebu Pacific Advisory #4
Cancelled Flights until October 30 Due to Tropical Storm Paeng (Nalgae)
As of October 29, 2022, 8:30PM https://t.co/8u1EE5sd2O

If these are done on-the-spot, our ground staff are on standby to assist affected guests.

For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the chatbot on https://t.co/SCMZemThl1
We continue to monitor the situation across all the airports we fly to. Everyjuan’s safety remains our top priority. CEB will do its best to inform guests ahead of time if flights are cancelled.

We urge passengers to avoid going to the airport unless they have confirmed flights. This is a developing situation. As such, there may be more flight changes as the tropical storm passes. Guests are urged to check real-time flight status updates via https://t.co/n8RpsOuboq
They may avail themselves of their preferred option online up to two (2) hours before their scheduled time of departure.
